  56++F0E4
  57++F0E4                              IFDEF DEBUG_LL120_DIRECT
  58++F0E4 ~            Debug_LL120_6502:       ld      a,0
  58++F0E4 ~             ld      (Tvar),a                  ; SLOPE 0 so calcualte YX = S X1lo * XX12+2
  59++F0E4 ~                                    ld      hl,20
  59++F0E4 ~             ld a,h
  59++F0E4 ~              ld (Svar),a
  59++F0E4 ~              ld a,l
  59++F0E4 ~              ld (XX1510),a  ; S x1lo = 20
  60++F0E4 ~                                    ld      a,140
  60++F0E4 ~             ld      (XX12p2),a                ; XX12+2  140, gradient 0.546875
  61++F0E4 ~                                    ld      a,0
  61++F0E4 ~             ld      (XX12p3),a                ; SLOPE DIRECTION so -ve result
  62++F0E4 ~                                    ; post LL129 Q = 140 a = 00  SR YX = (20 * 140) /256 * -1 = -10
  63++F0E4 ~                                    call    LL120_6502  ; Expect mulitply so (Y X) -10      >> PASS
  64++F0E4 ~                                    break
  65++F0E4 ~                                    ld      a,0
  65++F0E4 ~             ld      (Tvar),a                  ; SLOPE 0 so calcualte YX = S X1lo * XX12+2
  66++F0E4 ~                                    ld      hl,20
  66++F0E4 ~             ld a,h
  66++F0E4 ~              ld (Svar),a
  66++F0E4 ~              ld a,l
  66++F0E4 ~              ld (XX1510),a  ; S x1lo = 20
  67++F0E4 ~                                    ld      a,140
  67++F0E4 ~             ld      (XX12p2),a                ; XX12+2 140, gradient 0.546875
  68++F0E4 ~                                    ld      a,$FF
  68++F0E4 ~             ld      (XX12p3),a                ; sLOPE DIRECTION so +ve result
  69++F0E4 ~                                    ; post LL129 Q = 140 a = FF  SR = 20  YX = (20 * 140) /256 = 10
  70++F0E4 ~                                    call    LL120_6502  ; Expect / so (Y X)10                   >> PASS
  71++F0E4 ~                                    break
  72++F0E4 ~                                    ld      a,$FF
  72++F0E4 ~             ld      (Tvar),a                  ; SLOPE <> 0 so calcualte YX = S X1lo / XX12+2
  73++F0E4 ~                                    ld      hl,20
  73++F0E4 ~             ld a,h
  73++F0E4 ~              ld (Svar),a
  73++F0E4 ~              ld a,l
  73++F0E4 ~              ld (XX1510),a  ; S x1lo = 20
  74++F0E4 ~                                    ld      a,140
  74++F0E4 ~             ld      (XX12p2),a                ; XX12+2 140, gradient 0.546875
  75++F0E4 ~                                    ld      a,$00
  75++F0E4 ~             ld      (XX12p3),a                ; sLOPE DIRECTION  so -ve result
  76++F0E4 ~                                    ; post LL129 Q = 140 a = 00  SR = 20  YX = (20 *256 / 140) = -36
  77++F0E4 ~                                    call    LL120_6502  ; Expect / so (Y X)-36
  78++F0E4 ~                                    ld      a,$FF
  78++F0E4 ~             ld      (Tvar),a                  ; SLOPE <> 0 so calcualte YX = S X1lo / XX12+2
  79++F0E4 ~                                    ld      hl,20
  79++F0E4 ~             ld a,h
  79++F0E4 ~              ld (Svar),a
  79++F0E4 ~              ld a,l
  79++F0E4 ~              ld (XX1510),a  ; S x1lo = 20
  80++F0E4 ~                                    ld      a,140
  80++F0E4 ~             ld      (XX12p2),a                ; XX12+2 140, gradient 0.546875
  81++F0E4 ~                                    ld      a,$FF
  81++F0E4 ~             ld      (XX12p3),a                ; sLOPE DIRECTION  so +ve result
  82++F0E4 ~                                    ; post LL129 Q = 140 a = 00 SR = 20 YX = (20 *256 / 140) = 36
  83++F0E4 ~                                    call    LL120_6502  ; Expect / so (Y X)  36                   >> PASS
  84++F0E4 ~                                    ret
  85++F0E4                              ENDIF
  86++F0E4              ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  87++F0E4              ;-- Calculate the following:
  88++F0E4              ;--         * If T = 0, this is a shallow slope, so calculate (Y X) = (S R) / XX12+2
  89++F0E4              ;--         * If T <> 0, this is a steep slope, so calculate (Y X) = (S R) * XX12+2
  90++F0E4              ;--             giving (Y X) the opposite sign to the slope direction in XX12+3.
  91++F0E4                              IFDEF DEBUG_LL123_DIRECT
  92++F0E4 ~            Debug_LL123_6502:       ld      a,$00
  92++F0E4 ~             ld      (Tvar),a                  ; SLOPE 0 (Y X) = (S R) / XX12+2
  93++F0E4 ~                                    ld      hl,20
  93++F0E4 ~             ld      (SRvarPair),hl
  94++F0E4 ~                                    ld      a,140
  94++F0E4 ~             ld      (XX12p2),a                ; XX12+2 gradient 0.546875
  95++F0E4 ~                                    ld      a,0
  95++F0E4 ~             ld      (XX12p3),a                ; sLOPE DIRECTION
  96++F0E4 ~                                    call    LL123_6502  ; Expect * so (Y X)-36 = (20 / 140 ) * 256 * -1 PASS
  97++F0E4 ~                                    break
  98++F0E4 ~                                    ld      a,$00
  98++F0E4 ~             ld      (Tvar),a                  ; SLOPE 0 (Y X) = (S R) / XX12+2
  99++F0E4 ~                                    ld      hl,20
  99++F0E4 ~             ld      (SRvarPair),hl
 100++F0E4 ~                                    ld      a,140
 100++F0E4 ~             ld      (XX12p2),a                ; XX12+2 gradient 0.546875
 101++F0E4 ~                                    ld      a,$FF
 101++F0E4 ~             ld      (XX12p3),a                ; sLOPE DIRECTION
 102++F0E4 ~                                    call    LL123_6502  ; Expect * so (Y X)36 = (20 / 140 ) * 256  PASS
 103++F0E4 ~                                    break
 104++F0E4 ~                                    ld      a,$FF
 104++F0E4 ~             ld      (Tvar),a                  ; SLOPE <> 0 (Y X) = (S R) * XX12+2
 105++F0E4 ~                                    ld      hl,20
 105++F0E4 ~             ld      (SRvarPair),hl
 106++F0E4 ~                                    ld      a,140
 106++F0E4 ~             ld      (XX12p2),a                ; XX12+2 gradient 0.546875
 107++F0E4 ~                                    ld      a,$00
 107++F0E4 ~             ld      (XX12p3),a                ; sLOPE DIRECTION
 108++F0E4 ~                                    call    LL123_6502  ; Expect / so (Y X)-10 (20 * 140 ) / 256 * -1 PASS
 109++F0E4 ~                                    ld      a,$FF
 109++F0E4 ~             ld      (Tvar),a                  ; SLOPE <> 0 (Y X) = (S R) * XX12+2
 110++F0E4 ~                                    ld      hl,20
 110++F0E4 ~             ld      (SRvarPair),hl
 111++F0E4 ~                                    ld      a,140
 111++F0E4 ~             ld      (XX12p2),a                ; XX12+2 gradient 0.546875
 112++F0E4 ~                                    ld      a,$FF
 112++F0E4 ~             ld      (XX12p3),a                ; sLOPE DIRECTION
 113++F0E4 ~                                    call    LL123_6502  ; Expect / so (Y X) 10 (20 * 140 ) / 256  PASS
 114++F0E4 ~                                    ret
 115++F0E4                              ENDIF
 116++F0E4
 117++F0E4                              IFDEF DEBUG_LL118_DIRECT
 118++F0E4 3E FF        Debug_LL118_6502:       ld      a,$FF
 118++F0E6 32 32 F1      ld      (Tvar),a                  ; SLOPE FF so steep
 119++F0E9 21 EC FF                             ld      hl,-20
 119++F0EC 22 26 F1      ld      (XX1510),hl               ; x1 = -20
 120++F0EF 21 EC FF                             ld      hl,-20
 120++F0F2 22 28 F1      ld      (XX1532),hl               ; y1 = -20
 121++F0F5 3E 78                                ld      a,120
 121++F0F7 32 2E F1      ld      (XX12p2),a                ; XX12+2 = 120 (120/256) = 0.46875
 122++F0FA 3E 00                                ld      a,0
 122++F0FC 32 2F F1      ld      (XX12p3),a                ; Slope Direction so TL to BR
 123++F0FF                                      ; -20, -20 steep TL>BR, gradient 120/256: Dir -1 so
 124++F0FF CD 80 F2                             call    LL118_6502  ; Expect * so x = 0 y =  -20 + (-20/(120/256)) = 22, x1 = 0 so stop there PASS
 125++F102 DD 01                                break
 126++F104
 127++F104 3E FF                                ld      a,$FF
 127++F106 32 32 F1      ld      (Tvar),a                  ; SLOPE FF so steep
 128++F109 21 E2 FF                             ld      hl,-30
 128++F10C 22 26 F1      ld      (XX1510),hl               ; x1 = -20
 129++F10F 21 EC FF                             ld      hl,-20
 129++F112 22 28 F1      ld      (XX1532),hl               ; y1 = -20
 130++F115 3E 3C                                ld      a,60
 130++F117 32 2E F1      ld      (XX12p2),a                ; XX12+2 = 120 (120/256) = 0.46875
 131++F11A 3E 00                                ld      a,0
 131++F11C 32 2F F1      ld      (XX12p3),a                ; Slope Direction so TL to BR
 132++F11F                                      ; -20, -20 steep TL>BR, gradient 120/256: Dir -1 so
 133++F11F CD 80 F2                             call    LL118_6502  ; Expect * so 108,0  FAIL
 134++F122 DD 01                                break
 135++F124 C9                                   ret
 136++F125                              ENDIF
 137++F125
 138++F125                              IFDEF DEBUG_LL28_6502
 139++F125 ~            Debug_LL28_6502:        ld      a,27
 139++F125 ~             ld     (Qvar),a
 140++F125 ~                                    ld      a,76
 141++F125 ~                                    call    LL28_6502   ; Expect $FF carry
 142++F125 ~                                    break
 143++F125 ~                                    ld      a,76
 143++F125 ~             ld     (Qvar),a
 144++F125 ~                                    ld      a,27        ; Expect 2
 145++F125 ~                                    call    LL28_6502
 146++F125 ~                                    break
 147++F125 ~                                    ld      a,200
 147++F125 ~             ld     (Qvar),a
 148++F125 ~                                    ld      a,50
 149++F125 ~                                    call    LL28_6502   ; Expect 4
 150++F125 ~                                    break
 151++F125 ~                                    ld      a,97
 151++F125 ~             ld     (Qvar),a
 152++F125 ~                                    ld      a,76
 153++F125 ~                                    call    LL28_6502   ; Expect 1
 154++F125 ~                                    break
 155++F125 ~                                    ld      a,$20
 155++F125 ~             ld     (Qvar),a
 156++F125 ~                                    ld      a,$10
 157++F125 ~                                    call    LL28_6502   ; Expect 1
 158++F125 ~                                    break
 159++F125 ~                                    ld      d,27
 160++F125 ~                                    ld      a,76
 161++F125 ~                                    call    AEquAmul256DivD
 162++F125 ~                                    break
 163++F125 ~                                    ld      d,76
 164++F125 ~                                    ld      a,27
 165++F125 ~                                    call    AEquAmul256DivD
 166++F125 ~                                    break
 167++F125 ~                                    ld      d,200
 168++F125 ~                                    ld      a,50
 169++F125 ~                                    call    AEquAmul256DivD
 170++F125 ~                                    break
 171++F125 ~                                    ld      d,$20
 172++F125 ~                                    ld      a,$10
 173++F125 ~                                    call    AEquAmul256DivD
 174++F125 ~                                    break
 175++F125 ~                                    ret
 176++F125                              ENDIF
 177++F125
 178++F125
 179++F125                              IFDEF DEBUG_LL145_6502
 180++F125 ~            Debug_LL145_6502:       ld      a,27
 180++F125 ~             ld     (Qvar),a
 181++F125 ~                                    ld      hl,-10
 181++F125 ~             ld     (XX1510),hl
 182++F125 ~                                    ld      hl,-10
 182++F125 ~             ld     (XX1532),hl
 183++F125 ~                                    ld      hl,110
 183++F125 ~             ld     (XX1554),hl
 184++F125 ~                                    ld      hl,50
 184++F125 ~             ld     (XX1576),hl
 185++F125 ~                                    call    LL145_6502  ; Should clip to p1 0,5, 110,50
 186++F125 ~                                    break
 187++F125 ~                                    ret
 188++F125                              ENDIF
 189++F125                      DEFINE DEBUG_6502_LINE_CLIPPING
 190++F125                      IFDEF DEBUG_6502_LINE_CLIPPING
 191++F125
 192++F125 00           xX13        DB 0
 193++F126 00 00        XX1510      DW 0    ; x1 as a 16-bit coordinate (x1_hi x1_lo)
 194++F128 00 00        XX1532      DW 0    ; y1 as a 16-bit coordinate (y1_hi y1_lo)
 195++F12A 00 00        XX1554      DW 0    ; x2
 196++F12C 00 00        XX1576      DW 0    ; y2
 197++F12E              XX1210      EQU XX1576
 198++F12E              XX12p1      EQU XX1210+1
 199++F12E 00           XX12p2      DB 0    ; The line's gradient * 256 (so 1.0 = 256)
 200++F12F 00           XX12p3      DB 0    ; The direction of slope ; + LT to BR; - TR to BL
 201++F130 00           XX12p4      DB 0
 202++F131 00           XX12p5      DB 0
 203++F132              Delta_x     EQU XX12p2
 204++F132              Delta_y     EQU XX12p4
 205++F132 00           Tvar        DB 0    ; The gradient of slope ; 0 if it's a shallow slope (DX > DY) ; &FF if it's a steep slope (DY > DX)
 206++F133                                  ; Returns:  XX15        m         x1 as an 8-bit coordinate XX15+2               y1 as an 8-bit coordinate
 207++F133 00           Qvar        DB 0
 208++F134 00           Rvar        DB 0    ; general purpose for calcs  Paired with S must be done this way round for SUBHeightFromY1 etc to work
 209++F135 00           Svar        DB 0    ; sign variable
 210++F136              SRvarPair   EQU Rvar
 211++F136 00           Xreg        DB 0
 212++F137 00           Yreg        DB 0
 213++F138              YXregPair   EQU Xreg
 214++F138
 215++F138              ;-- Name: LL28 Calculate R = 256 * A / Q
 216++F138              ;-- LL28+4              Skips the A >= Q check and always returns with C flag cleared, so this can be called if we know the division will work
 217++F138              ;-- LL31                Skips the A >= Q check and does not set the R counter, so this can be used for jumping straight into the division loop if R is already set to 254 and we know the division will work
 218++F138 21 33 F1     LL28_6502:          ld      hl,Qvar                 ; CMP Q                  \ If A >= Q, then the answer will not fit in one byte,
 219++F13B 4E                               ld      c,(hl)                  ; using c as Q var
 220++F13C B9                               cp      c
 221++F13D                                  FlipCarryFlag
 221++F13D 3F          >                        ccf
 222++F13E DA 65 F1                         jp      c, LL2_6502             ; BCS LL2                \ so jump to LL2 to return 255
 223++F141 06 FE                            ld      b,$FE                   ; LDX #%11111110         \ Set R to have bits 1-7 set, so we can rotate through 7 loop iterations, getting a 1 each time, and then we use b as Rvar
 224++F143 CB 27        LL31_6502:          sla     a                       ; ASL A                  \ Shift A to the left
 225++F145 DA 59 F1                         jp      c,LL29_6502             ; BCS LL29               \ If bit 7 of A was set, then jump straight to the subtraction
 226++F148                                  JumpIfALTNusng c, LL31_SKIPSUB_6502 ; CMP Q                  \ If A < Q, skip the following subtraction
 226++F148 B9          >                        cp      c
 226++F149 DA 4E F1    >                        jp		c, LL31_SKIPSUB_6502
 227++F14C                                                                  ; BCC P%+4
 228++F14C 91                               sub     c                       ; SBC Q                  \ A >= Q, so set A = A - Q
 229++F14D                                  ClearCarryFlag
 229++F14D B7          >                        or a
 230++F14E              LL31_SKIPSUB_6502:  FlipCarryFlag
 230++F14E 3F          >                        ccf
 231++F14F CB 10                            rl      b                       ; ROL R                  \ Rotate the counter in R to the left, and catch the result bit into bit 0 (which will be a 0 if we didn't do the subtraction, or 1 if we did)
 232++F151 DA 43 F1                         jp      c, LL31_6502            ; BCS LL31               \ If we still have set bits in R, loop back to LL31 to do the next iteration of 7
 233++F154 78                               ld      a,b
 234++F155 32 34 F1                         ld      (Rvar),a
 235++F158 C9                               ret                             ; RTS                    \ R left with remainder of division
 236++F159 91           LL29_6502:          sub     c                       ; SBC Q                  \ A >= Q, so set A = A - Q
 237++F15A                                  SetCarryFlag                    ; SEC                    \ Set the C flag to rotate into the result in R
 237++F15A 37          >                        scf
 238++F15B CB 11                            rl      c                       ; ROL R                  \ Rotate the counter in R to the left, and catch the result bit into bit 0 (which will be a 0 if we didn't do the subtraction, or 1 if we did)
 239++F15D DA 43 F1                         jp      c, LL31_6502            ; BCS LL31               \ If we still have set bits in R, loop back to LL31 to do the next iteration of 7
 240++F160 78                               ld      a,b                     ; RTS                    \ Return from the subroutine with R containing the
 241++F161 32 34 F1                         ld      (Rvar),a                ; .
 242++F164 C9                               ret                             ; .                      \ remainder of the division
 243++F165 3E FF        LL2_6502:           ld      a,$FF                   ; LDA #255               \ The division is very close to 1, so return the closest
 244++F167 32 34 F1                         ld      (Rvar),a                ; STA R                  \ possible answer to 256, i.e. R = 255
 245++F16A                                  SetCarryFlag                    ; we failed so need carry flag set
 245++F16A 37          >                        scf
 246++F16B C9                               ret                             ; RTS                    \ Return from the subroutine
 247++F16C
 248++F16C 3A 36 F1     ADDXRegtoY1:        ld      a,(Xreg)                ; Set y1 = y1 + (Y X)
 249++F16F 4F                               ld      c,a
 250++F170 06 00                            ld      b,0
 251++F172 2A 28 F1                         ld      hl,(XX1532)
 252++F175                                  ClearCarryFlag
 252++F175 B7          >                        or a
 253++F176 ED 4A                            adc     hl,bc
 254++F178 22 28 F1                         ld      (XX1532),hl
 255++F17B C9                               ret
 256++F17C
 257++F17C ED 4B 36 F1  ADDYXRegtoX1:       ld      bc,(YXregPair)          ; Set x1 = x1 + (Y X)
 258++F180 2A 26 F1                         ld      hl,(XX1510)
 259++F183                                  ClearCarryFlag
 259++F183 B7          >                        or a
 260++F184 ED 4A                            adc     hl,bc
 261++F186 22 26 F1                         ld      (XX1510),hl
 262++F189 C9                               ret
 263++F18A
 264++F18A 2A 28 F1     SUBBCFromY1:        ld      hl,(XX1532)             ; Set (S R) = (y1_hi y1_lo) - BC where BC can be say screen height
 265++F18D                                  ClearCarryFlag
 265++F18D B7          >                        or a
 266++F18E ED 42                            sbc     hl,bc
 267++F190 22 34 F1                         ld      (SRvarPair),hl
 268++F193 C9                               ret
 269++F194
 270++F194 2A 36 F1     AddSRToYX:          ld      hl,(YXregPair)
 271++F197 ED 5B 34 F1                      ld      de,(SRvarPair)
 272++F19B                                  ClearCarryFlag
 272++F19B B7          >                        or a
 273++F19C ED 5A                            adc     hl,de
 274++F19E 22 36 F1                         ld      (YXregPair),hl
 275++F1A1 C9                               ret
 276++F1A2
 277++F1A2              ShiftLeftMem:       MACRO   reg
 278++F1A2 ~                                ld      hl,reg
 279++F1A2 ~                                sla     (hl)
 280++F1A2                                  ENDM
 281++F1A2
 282++F1A2              ;-- Rountes to code:
 283++F1A2              ;-- LL118
 284++F1A2              ;-- LL120   Done
 285++F1A2              ;-- LL129   Done
 286++F1A2              ;-- LL123   Done
 287++F1A2                              ; NOTE DOES ABS ONLY
 288++F1A2
 289++F1A2
 290++F1A2                              ;--- LL118 Move along a point until on screen
 291++F1A2              ; In XX1510 x1 as a 16-bit coordinate (x1_hi x1_lo)
 292++F1A2              ;    XX1532 y1 as a 16-bit coordinate (y1_hi y1_lo)
 293++F1A2              ;    XX12p2 The line's gradient * 256 (so 1.0 = 256)
 294++F1A2              ;    XX12p3 The direction of slope: * Positive = top left to bottom right * Negative (bit 7 set) = top right to bottom left
 295++F1A2              ;    T      The gradient of slope:* 0 if it's a shallow slope * &FF if it's a steep slope
 296++F1A2              ;  Out  XX150               x1 as an 8-bit coordinate
 297++F1A2              ;       XX152               y1 as an 8-bit coordinate
 298++F1A2              ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 299++F1A2
 300++F1A2
 301++F1A2              ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 302++F1A2              ;--  Calculate the following:
 303++F1A2              ;--   * If T = 0, this is a shallow slope, so calculate (Y X) = (S x1_lo) * XX12+2
 304++F1A2              ;--   * If T <> 0, this is a steep slope, so calculate (Y X) = (S x1_lo) / XX12+2
 305++F1A2              ;-- giving (Y X) the opposite sign to the slope direction in XX12+3.
 306++F1A2              ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 307++F1A2 3A 26 F1     LL120_6502:         ld      a,(XX1510)              ;LDA XX15               \ Set R = x1_lo
 308++F1A5 32 34 F1                         ld      (Rvar),a                ;STA R
 309++F1A8 CD 54 F2                         call    LL129_6502              ;JSR LL129              \ Call LL129 to do the following:  Q = XX12+2 = line gradient, A = S EOR XX12+3 = S EOR slope direction  (S R) = |S R|
 310++F1AB F5                               push    af                      ;PHA                    \ Store A on the stack so we can use it later
 311++F1AC              ; DONT NEED PLUS MESSES UP FLAGS                    push    af                      ;LDX T                  \ If T is non-zero, then it's a steep slope, so jump
 312++F1AC 3A 32 F1                         ld      a,(Tvar)                ; .
 313++F1AF 32 36 F1                         ld      (Xreg),a                ;.
 314++F1B2 A7                               and     a                       ;BNE LL121              \ down to LL121 to calculate this instead (Y X) = (S R) / Q
 315++F1B3              ; DONT NEED PLUS MESSES UP FLAGS                    pop     af                      ;.                      (recover teh saved A before the cp)
 316++F1B3 20 48                            jr      nz,LL121_6502           ;.
 317++F1B5              ;..   (Y X) = (S R) * Q - must be ABS, sign determined by opposite of the sign of the value on top of stack
 318++F1B5              LL122_6502:         ZeroA                           ;LDA #0                 \ Set A = 0
 318++F1B5 AF          >                        xor a
 319++F1B6                          IFDEF DEBUG_LL122_DIRECT
 320++F1B6 ~                                DISPLAY "DIRECT CALL TO LL122 so dummy push a to stack with 0"
 321++F1B6 ~                                push    af
 322++F1B6                          ENDIF
 323++F1B6 32 36 F1                         ld      (Xreg),a                ;TAX                    \ Set (Y X) = 0 so we can start building the answer here
 324++F1B9 32 37 F1                         ld      (Yreg),a                ;TAY
 325++F1BC 21 35 F1                         ld      hl,Svar
 326++F1BF ED 4B 34 F1                      ld      bc,(SRvarPair)          ;LSR S                  \ Shift (S R) to the right, so we extract bit 0 of (S R)
 327++F1C3                                  ShiftBCRight1                   ;ROR R                  \ into the C flag
 327++F1C3 CB 38       >			   srl b
 327++F1C5 CB 19       >			   rr  c
 328++F1C7 ED 43 34 F1                      ld      (SRvarPair),bc
 329++F1CB 21 33 F1                         ld      hl, Qvar                ;ASL Q                  \ Shift Q to the left, catching bit 7 in the C flag
 330++F1CE CB 26                            sla     (hl)                    ;.
 331++F1D0 30 03                            jr      nc, LL126_6502          ;BCC LL126              \ If C (i.e. the next bit from Q) is clear, do not do
 332++F1D2                                                                  ;                         the addition for this bit of Q, and instead skip to LL126 to just do the shifts
 333++F1D2 CD 94 F1     LL125_6502:         call    AddSRToYX               ;TXA                    \ Set (Y X) = (Y X) + (S R)  starting with the low bytes And then doing the high bytes
 334++F1D5 ED 4B 34 F1  LL126_6502:         ld      bc,(SRvarPair)          ;LSR S                  \ Shift (S R) to the right
 335++F1D9                                  ShiftBCRight1                   ;ROR R
 335++F1D9 CB 38       >			   srl b
 335++F1DB CB 19       >			   rr  c
 336++F1DD ED 43 34 F1                      ld      (SRvarPair),bc          ;.
 337++F1E1 21 33 F1                         ld      hl, Qvar                ;ASL Q                  \ Shift Q to the left, catching bit 7 in the C flag
 338++F1E4 CB 26                            sla     (hl)                    ;.
 339++F1E6 38 EA                            jr      c,LL125_6502            ;BCS LL125              \ If C (i.e. the next bit from Q) is set, loop back to LL125 to do the addition for this bit of Q
 340++F1E8 20 EB                            jr      nz,LL126_6502           ;BNE LL126              \ If Q has not yet run out of set bits, loop back to LL126 to do the "shift" part of shift-and-add until we have done additions for all the set bits in Q, to give us our multiplication result
 341++F1EA F1                               pop     af                      ;PLA                    \ Restore A, which we calculated above, from the stack
 342++F1EB A7                               and     a                       ;BPL LL133              \ If A is positive jump to LL133 to negate (Y X) and
 343++F1EC F2 45 F2                         jp      p,LL133_6502            ;.
 344++F1EF              ;.. return from the subroutine using a tail call
 345++F1EF C9                               ret                             ;RTS                    \ Return from the subroutine
 346++F1F0
 347++F1F0              ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 348++F1F0              ;-- Calculate the following:
 349++F1F0              ;--         * If T = 0, this is a shallow slope, so calculate (Y X) = (S R) / XX12+2 (does not use X1lo but directly SR)
 350++F1F0              ;--         * If T <> 0, this is a steep slope, so calculate (Y X) = (S R) * XX12+2  (does not use X1lo but directly SR)
 351++F1F0              ;--             giving (Y X) the opposite sign to the slope direction in XX12+3.
 352++F1F0 CD 54 F2     LL123_6502:         call    LL129_6502              ;JSR LL129              \ Call LL129 to do the following   Q = XX12+2   = line gradient
 353++F1F3 F5                               push    af                      ;PHA                    \ Store A on the stack so we can use it later
 354++F1F4              ; DONT NEED PLUS MESSES UP FLAGS                    push    af                      ;LDX T                  \ If T is non-zero, then it's a steep slope, so jump up
 355++F1F4 3A 32 F1                         ld      a,(Tvar)                ; .
 356++F1F7 32 36 F1                         ld      (Xreg),a                ;BNE LL122              \ to LL122 to calculate this instead:
 357++F1FA A7                               and     a                       ;.
 358++F1FB              ;  DONT NEED PLUS MESSES UP FLAGS                    pop     af                      ;.
 359++F1FB 20 B8                            jr      nz,LL122_6502           ;.
 360++F1FD              ;--  The following calculates: (Y X) = (S R) / Q using the same shift-and-subtract algorithm that's documented in TIS2
 361++F1FD 3E FF        LL121_6502:         ld      a,$FF                   ;LDA #%11111111         \ Set Y = %11111111
 362++F1FF 32 37 F1                         ld      (Yreg),a                ;TAY
 363++F202 CB 27                            sla     a                       ;ASL A                  \ Set X = %11111110
 364++F204 32 36 F1                         ld      (Xreg),a                ;TAX
 365++F207              ;--  This sets (Y X) = %1111111111111110, so we can rotate through 15 loop iterations, getting a 1 each time, and then getting a 0 on the 16th iteration... and we can also use it to catch our result bits into bit 0 each time
 366++F207 ED 4B 34 F1  LL130_6502:         ld      bc,(SRvarPair)          ;ASL R                  \ Shift (S R) to the left
 367++F20B                                  ShiftBCLeft1                    ;.
 367++F20B CB 21       >			   sla c
 367++F20D CB 10       >			   rl  b
 368++F20F ED 43 34 F1                      ld      (SRvarPair),bc          ;ROL S
 369++F213 3A 35 F1                         ld      a,(Svar)                ;LDA S                  \ Set A = S
 370++F216 38 07                            jr      c, LL131_6502           ;BCS LL131              \ If bit 7 of S was set, then jump straight to the subtraction
 371++F218 21 33 F1                         ld      hl,Qvar                 ;CMP Q                  \ If A < Q (i.e. S < Q), skip the following subtractions
 372++F21B BE                               cp      (hl)
 373++F21C                                  FlipCarryFlag                   ; note flip carry flag here to simulate 6502 operation
 373++F21C 3F          >                        ccf
 374++F21D 30 12                            jr      nc,LL132A_6502          ;BCC LL132  (NOTE Carry flag reversed in Z80 for CP)
 375++F21F              LL131_6502:         FlipCarryFlag                   ;flip carry to make it act like a 6502 borrow
 375++F21F 3F          >                        ccf
 376++F220 9E                               sbc     (hl)                    ;SBC Q                  \ A >= Q (i.e. S >= Q) so set:
 377++F221 32 35 F1                         ld      (Svar),a                ;STA S
 378++F224 3A 34 F1                         ld      a,(Rvar)                ;LDA R                  \ And then doing the high bytes
 379++F227                                  ClearCarryFlag                  ;\   S = (A R) - Q  = (S R) - Q starting with the low bytes (we know the C flag is set so the subtraction will be correct)
 379++F227 B7          >                        or a
 380++F228 DE 00                            sbc     0                       ;SBC #0
 381++F22A 32 34 F1                         ld      (Rvar),a                ;STA R
 382++F22D                                  SetCarryFlag                    ;SEC                    \ Set the C flag to rotate into the result in (Y X)
 382++F22D 37          >                        scf
 383++F22E C3 32 F2                         jp      LL132_6502              ;added so that we can do a 6502 style carry above
 384++F231 00           LL132A_6502:        nop; FlipCarryFlag
 385++F232 ED 4B 36 F1  LL132_6502:         ld      bc,(YXregPair)          ; Rotate the counter in (Y X) to the left, and catch the
 386++F236                                  RollBCLeft1                     ; ROL A                  \ result bit into bit 0 (which will be a 0 if we didn't
 386++F236 CB 11       >               rl  c
 386++F238 CB 10       >               rl  b
 387++F23A ED 43 36 F1                      ld      (YXregPair),bc          ; TAX                    \ do the subtraction, or 1 if we did)
 388++F23E 38 C7                            jr      c, LL130_6502           ; BCS LL130              \ If we still have set bits in (Y X), loop back to LL130 to do the next iteration of 15, until we have done the whole division
 389++F240                          IFDEF DEBUG_LL121_DIRECT
 390++F240 ~                                DISPLAY "DIRECT CALL TO LL121 so dummy push"
 391++F240 ~                                push    af
 392++F240                          ENDIF
 393++F240 F1                               pop     af                      ; PLA                    \ Restore A, which we calculated above, from the stack
 394++F241 A7                               and     a                       ; BMI LL128              \ If A is negative jump to LL128 to return from the
 395++F242 FA 53 F2                         jp      m, LL128_6502           ; .                      \ subroutine with (Y X) as is
 396++F245 ED 4B 36 F1  LL133_6502:         ld      bc,(YXregPair)          ; TXA                    \ Otherwise negate (Y X) using two's complement by first
 397++F249                                  macronegate16bc                 ; EOR #%11111111         \ setting the low byte to ~X + 1
 397++F249 AF          >					xor 	a
 397++F24A 91          >                    sub 	c
 397++F24B 4F          >                    ld 		c,a
 397++F24C 9F          >                    sbc 	a,a
 397++F24D 90          >                    sub 	b
 397++F24E 47          >                    ld 		b,a
 398++F24F ED 43 36 F1                      ld      (YXregPair),bc          ; ADC #1                 \ The addition works as we know the C flag is clear from\ when we passed through the BCS above
 399++F253 C9           LL128_6502:         ret                             ; RTS                    \ Return from the subroutine
 400++F254              ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 401++F254              ;..  Do the following, in this order: Q = XX12+2 A = S EOR XX12+3 (S R) = |S R|
 402++F254              ;..  This sets up the variables required above to calculate (S R) / XX12+2 and give the result the opposite sign to XX13+3.
 403++F254 F5           LL129_6502:         push    af                      ;LDX XX12+2             \ Set Q = XX12+2
 404++F255 3A 2E F1                         ld      a,(XX12p2)              ;.
 405++F258 32 36 F1                         ld      (Xreg),a                ;.
 406++F25B 32 33 F1                         ld      (Qvar),a                ;STX Q
 407++F25E F1                               pop     af                      ;.
 408++F25F 3A 35 F1                         ld      a,(Svar)                ;LDA S                  \ If S is positive, jump to LL127
 409++F262 A7                               and     a                       ;BPL LL127
 410++F263 F2 7B F2                         jp      p,LL127_6502            ;.
 411++F266                                  ZeroA                           ;.LDA #0                \ Otherwise set R = -R
 411++F266 AF          >                        xor a
 412++F267                                  ClearCarryFlag                  ;SEC
 412++F267 B7          >                        or a
 413++F268 21 34 F1                         ld      hl, Rvar                ;SBC R
 414++F26B 9E                               sbc     (hl)                    ;.
 415++F26C 32 34 F1                         ld      (Rvar),a                ;STA R
 416++F26F 3A 35 F1                         ld      a,(Svar)                ;LDA S                  \ Push S onto the stack
 417++F272 F5                               push    af                      ;PHA
 418++F273 EE FF                            xor     $FF                     ;EOR #%11111111         \ Set S = ~S + 1 + C  ?? is this all just doing |Svar|?
 419++F275 CE 00                            adc     0                       ;ADC #0
 420++F277 32 35 F1                         ld      (Svar),a                ;STA S
 421++F27A F1                               pop     af                      ;PLA                    \ Pull the original, negative S from the stack into A
 422++F27B 21 2F F1     LL127_6502:         ld      hl,XX12p3               ;EOR XX12+3             \ Set A = original argument S EOR'd with XX12+3
 423++F27E AE                               xor     (hl)                    ;.
 424++F27F C9                               ret                             ;RTS                    \ Return from the subroutine
 425++F280              ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 426++F280              ;--- LL118 Move along a point until on screen
 427++F280              ; In XX1510 x1 as a 16-bit coordinate (x1_hi x1_lo)
 428++F280              ;    XX1532 y1 as a 16-bit coordinate (y1_hi y1_lo)
 429++F280              ;    XX12p2 The line's gradient * 256 (so 1.0 = 256)
 430++F280              ;    XX12p3 The direction of slope: * Positive = top left to bottom right * Negative (bit 7 set) = top right to bottom left
 431++F280              ;    T      The gradient of slope:* 0 if it's a shallow slope * &FF if it's a steep slope
 432++F280              ;  Out  XX150               x1 as an 8-bit coordinate
 433++F280              ;       XX152               y1 as an 8-bit coordinate
 434++F280              ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 435++F280
 436++F280 3A 27 F1     LL118_6502:         ld      a,(XX1510+1)            ; LDA XX15+1             \ If x1_hi is positive, jump down to LL119 to skip the
 437++F283 A7                               and     a                       ; BPL LL119              \ .
 438++F284 F2 A1 F2                         jp      p, LL119_6502           ;                        \ following
 439++F287 32 35 F1     .X1Positive:        ld      (Svar),a                ; STA S                  \ Otherwise x1_hi is negative, i.e. off the left of the screen, so set S = x1_hi
 440++F28A CD A2 F1                         call    LL120_6502              ; Call LL120 to calculate:  (Y X) = (S x1_lo) * XX12+2      if T = 0   = x1 * gradient
 441++F28D                                                                  ;                            (Y X) = (S x1_lo) / XX12+2      if T <> 0  = x1 / gradient
 442++F28D                                                                  ; with the sign of (Y X) set to the opposite of the line's direction of slope
 443++F28D CD 6C F1                         call    ADDXRegtoY1             ; Set y1 = y1 + (Y X)
 444++F290 22 28 F1                         ld      (XX1532),hl             ; .
 445++F293 21 00 00                         ld      hl,0                    ; Set x1 = 0
 446++F296 22 26 F1                         ld      (XX1510),hl             ; .
 447++F299 3E 00                            ld      a,0                     ; set 0 up for replacemetn of the TAX and BEQ bit
 448++F29B 32 36 F1                         ld      (Xreg),a                ; TAX                    \ Set X = 0 so the next BEQ becomes a jmp but we will do it anyway in next line
 449++F29E C3 B7 F2                         jp      LL134_6502              ; just do the jump to LL134 rather than setting to equal flag and then jumping
 450++F2A1              ;-- Entering LL119 a will always be the value of X1 Hi byte
 451++F2A1 CA B7 F2     LL119_6502:         jp      z,LL134_6502            ; BEQ LL134              \ x1_hi = 0 then jump down to LL134 to skip the following, as the x-coordinate is already on-screen
 452++F2A4                                                                  ;                        \ (as 0 <= (x_hi x_lo) <= 255)
 453++F2A4 32 35 F1                         ld      (Svar),a                ; STA S                  \ Otherwise x1_hi is positive, i.e. x1 >= 256 and off
 454++F2A7 3D                               dec     a                       ; DEC S                  \ the right side of the screen, so set S = x1_hi - 1
 455++F2A8 32 35 F1                         ld      (Svar),a                ;
 456++F2AB CD A2 F1                         call    LL120_6502              ; JSR LL120              \ Call LL120 to calculate:  (Y X) = (S x1_lo) * XX12+2      if T = 0   = (x1 - 256) * gradient
 457++F2AE                                                                  ;                        \                           (Y X) = (S x1_lo) / XX12+2      if T <> 0 = (x1 - 256) / gradient
 458++F2AE                                                                  ;                        \ with the sign of (Y X) set to the opposite of the line's direction of slope
 459++F2AE CD 6C F1                         call    ADDXRegtoY1             ; TXA                    \ Set y1 = y1 + (Y X)
 460++F2B1 21 FF 00                         ld      hl,255                  ; LDX #255               \ Set x1 = 255
 461++F2B4 22 26 F1                         ld      (XX1510),hl             ; STX XX15 ;INX; STX XX15+1
 462++F2B7              ;--  We have moved the point so the x-coordinate is on  screen (i.e. in the range 0-255), so now for the  y-coordinate
 463++F2B7 3A 29 F1     LL134_6502:         ld      a,(XX1532+1)            ; LDA XX15+3             \ If y1_hi is positive, jump down to LL119 to skip
 464++F2BA A7                               and     a                       ; BPL LL135              \ the following
 465++F2BB F2 D3 F2                         jp      p, LL135_6502           ; .
 466++F2BE 32 35 F1                         ld      (Svar),a                ; STA S                  \ Otherwise y1_hi is negative, i.e. off the top of the screen, so set S = y1_hi
 467++F2C1 3A 28 F1                         ld      a, (XX1532)             ; LDA XX15+2             \ Set R = y1_lo
 468++F2C4 32 34 F1                         ld      (Rvar),a                ; STA R
 469++F2C7 CD F0 F1                         call    LL123_6502              ; JSR LL123              \ Call LL123 to calculate:  (Y X) = (S R) / XX12+2      if T = 0 = y1 / gradient
 470++F2CA                                                                  ;                        \                           (Y X) = (S R) * XX12+2      if T <> 0 = y1 * gradient
 471++F2CA                                                                  ;                         with the sign of (Y X) set to the opposite of the line's direction of slope
 472++F2CA CD 7C F1                         call    ADDYXRegtoX1            ; TXA                    \ Set x1 = x1 + (Y X)
 473++F2CD 21 00 00                         ld      hl,0                    ; LDA #0                 \ Set y1 = 0
 474++F2D0 22 28 F1                         ld      (XX1532),hl             ; STA XX15+2, XX15+3
 475++F2D3 01 80 00     LL135_6502:         ld      bc,128                  ; LDA XX15+2             \ Set (S R) = (y1_hi y1_lo) - screen height
 476++F2D6 CD 8A F1                         call    SUBBCFromY1             ; .                      \ .
 477++F2D9 38 0C                            jr      c, LL136_6502           ; BCC LL136              \ If the subtraction underflowed, i.e. if y1 < screen height, then y1 is already on-screen, so jump to LL136
 478++F2DB                                                                  ;                        \ to return from the subroutine, as we are done
 479++F2DB              ;;-   If we get here then y1 >= screen height, i.e. off the bottom of the screen
 480++F2DB CD F0 F1     LL139_6502:         call    LL123_6502              ; JSR LL123              \ Call LL123 to calculate:   (Y X) = (S R) / XX12+2      if T = 0  = (y1 - screen height) / gradient
 481++F2DE                                                                  ;                        \                            (Y X) = (S R) * XX12+2      if T <> 0 = (y1 - screen height) * gradient
 482++F2DE                                                                  ;                          with the sign of (Y X) set to the opposite of the line's direction of slope
 483++F2DE CD 7C F1                         call    ADDYXRegtoX1            ; TXA                    \ Set x1 = x1 + (Y X)
 484++F2E1 21 7F 00                         ld      hl, 127                 ; LDA #Y*2-1             \ Set y1 = 2 * #Y - 1. The constant #Y is 96, the y-coordinate of the mid-point of the space view (or in our case 127)
 485++F2E4 22 28 F1                         ld      (XX1532),hl             ; STA XX15+3             \ pixel row of the space view
 486++F2E7 C9           LL136_6502:         ret                             ; RTS                    \ Return from the subroutine
 487++F2E8              ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 488++F2E8              ;-- LL145 LINE CLIP
 489++F2E8              ;-- OPTISIATIONS - VERTICAL HORZONTAL POINT |DX| = |DY| (and all the veriants for +/-)
 490++F2E8              ;-- This routine clips the line from (x1, y1) to (x2, y2) so it fits on-screen, or returns an error if it can't be clipped to fit. The arguments are 16-bit coordinates, and the clipped line is returned using 8-bit screen coordinates.
 491++F2E8              ;-- This part sets XX13 to reflect which of the two points are on-screen and off-screen.
 492++F2E8              ;-- IN  : XX15(1 0) x1 XX15(3 2) y1 XX15(5 4) x2 XX12(1 0) y2
 493++F2E8              ;-- OUT : (X1, Y1), (X2, Y2) Screen coordinate C flag  Clear if the clipped line fits on-screen, set if itdoesn't
 494++F2E8              ;         XX13 The state of the original coordinates on-screen:* 0   = (x2, y2) on-screen* 95(64)  = (x1, y1) on-screen,  (x2, y2) off-screen* 191(128) = (x1, y1) off-screen, (x2, y2) off-screen
 495++F2E8              ;              So XX13 is non-zero if the end of the line was clipped,meaning the next line sent to BLINE can't join onto the end but has to start a new segment
 496++F2E8              ;         SWAP The swap status of the returned coordinates:* &FF if we swapped the values of (x1, y1) and(x2, y2) as part of the clipping process* 0 if the coordinates are still in the same order
 497++F2E8              LL145_6502:         ZeroA                           ; LDA #0                 \ Set SWAP = 0
 497++F2E8 AF          >                        xor a
 498++F2E9 32 18 C9                         ld      (SWAP),a                ; STA SWAP
 499++F2EC 3A 2B F1                         ld      a,(XX1554+1)            ; LDA XX15+5             \ Set A = x2_hi (use b as a substibute for a)
 500++F2EF 47                               ld      b,a
 501++F2F0 3E 7F        LL147_6502:         ld      a,127                   ; LDX #Y*2-1             \ Set X = #Y * 2 - 1. The constant #Y is 96, the y-coordinate of the mid-point of the space view, so this sets Y2 to 191, the y-coordinate of the bottom pixel row of the space view
 502++F2F2 4F                               ld      c,a                     ;                          using x as a temporary x reg
 503++F2F3 32 36 F1                         ld      (Xreg),a                ; .
 504++F2F6 78                               ld      a,b                     ; ORA XX12+1             \ If one or both of x2_hi and y2_hi are non-zero, jump
 505++F2F7 21 2D F1                         ld      hl,XX12p1               ; .
 506++F2FA B6                               or      (hl)                    ; .
 507++F2FB C2 0A F3                         jp      nz,LL107_6502           ; BNE LL107              \ to LL107 to skip the following, leaving X at 191
 508++F2FE 79                               ld      a,c                     ; get back the temporary x reg from c
 509++F2FF 21 2C F1                         ld      hl,XX1210               ; CPX XX12               \ If y2_lo > the y-coordinate of the bottom of screen (a is being used as X at this point still)
 510++F302 BE                               cp      (hl)                    ; .
 511++F303 DA 0A F3                         jp      c,LL107_6502            ; BCC LL107              \ then (x2, y2) is off the bottom of the screen, so skip the following instruction, leaving X at 127
 512++F306                                  ZeroA                           ; LDX #0                 \ Set X = 0
 512++F306 AF          >                        xor a
 513++F307 32 36 F1                         ld      (Xreg),a
 514++F30A 3A 36 F1     LL107_6502:         ld      a,(Xreg)                ; STX XX13               \ Set XX13 = X, so we have * XX13 = 0 if x2_hi = y2_hi = 0, y2_lo is on-screen* XX13 = 191 if x2_hi or y2_hi are non-zero or y2_lois off the bottom of the screen
 515++F30D 32 70 7E                         ld      (XX13),a                ; now c is released as a temporary x reg
 516++F310 3A 27 F1                         ld      a,(XX1510+1)            ; LDA XX15+1             \ If one or both of x1_hi and y1_hi are non-zero, jump
 517++F313 21 29 F1                         ld      hl,XX1532+1             ; ORA XX15+3             \ to LL83
 518++F316 B6                               or      (hl)                    ; .
 519++F317 C2 4A F3                         jp      nz,LL83_6502            ; BNE LL83
 520++F31A 3E 7F                            ld      a,127                   ; LDA #Y*2-1             \ If y1_lo > the y-coordinate of the bottom of screen
 521++F31C 2A 28 F1                         ld      hl,(XX1532)             ; CMP XX15+2             \ then (x1, y1) is off the bottom of the screen, so jump
 522++F31F BE                               cp      (hl)                    ; .
 523++F320 D2 4A F3                         jp      nc, LL83_6502           ; BCC LL83               \ to LL83 If we get here, (x1, y1) is on-screen
 524++F323 3A 70 7E                         ld      a,(XX13)                ; LDA XX13               \ If XX13 is non-zero, i.e. (x2, y2) is off-screen, jump
 525++F326 A7                               and     a                       ; BNE LL108              \ to LL108 to halve it before continuing at LL83
 526++F327 C2 45 F3                         jp      nz,LL108_6502
 527++F32A              ; If we get here, the high bytes are all zero, which means the x-coordinates are < 256 and therefore fit on screen, and neither coordinate is off the bottom of the screen. That means both coordinates are already on
 528++F32A              ; screen, so we don't need to do any clipping, all weneed to do is move the low bytes into (X1, Y1) and X2, Y2) and return
 529++F32A              ; X1 = XX15 (10)  Y1 = XX15+1 X2 = XX15+2 Y2 = XX15+3
 530++F32A 2A 28 F1     LL146_6502:         ld      hl,(XX1532)
 531++F32D ED 5B 2A F1                      ld      de,(XX1554)
 532++F331 ED 4B 2C F1                      ld      bc,(XX1576)
 533++F335 7D                               ld      a,l
 534++F336 32 27 F1                         ld      (XX1510+1),a
 535++F339 7B                               ld      a,e
 536++F33A 32 28 F1                         ld      (XX1510+2),a
 537++F33D 79                               ld      a,c
 538++F33E 32 29 F1                         ld      (XX1510+3),a
 539++F341                                  ClearCarryFlag                  ; CLC                    \ Clear the C flag as the clipped line fits on-screen
 539++F341 B7          >                        or a
 540++F342 C9                               ret                             ; RTS                    \ Return from the subroutine
 541++F343              LL109_6502:         SetCarryFlag                    ; SEC                    \ Set the C flag to indicate the clipped line does not fit on-screen
 541++F343 37          >                        scf
 542++F344 C9                               ret                             ; RTS                    \ Return from the subroutine
 543++F345 21 70 7E     LL108_6502:         ld      hl,XX13                 ; LSR XX13               \ If we get here then (x2, y2) is off-screen and XX13 is
 544++F348 CB 3E                            srl     (hl)                    ;                        \ 191, (128)  so shift XX13 right to halve it to 95 (64)
 545++F34A              ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 546++F34A              ;-- LL145 (Part 2 of 4)
 547++F34A 3A 70 7E     LL83_6502:          ld      a,(XX13)                ; LDA XX13               \ If XX13 < 128 then only one of the points is on-screen
 548++F34D A7                               and     a                       ; BPL LL115              \ so jump down to LL115 to skip the checks of whether
 549++F34E F2 9C F3                         jp      p,LL115_6502            ;                        \ both points are in the strips to the right or bottom of the screen
 550++F351              ;-- If we get here, both points are off-screen
 551++F351 3A 27 F1                         ld      a,(XX1510+1)            ; LDA XX15+1             \ If both x1_hi and x2_hi have bit 7 set, jump to LL109
 552++F354 21 2B F1                         ld      hl,XX1554+1             ; AND XX15+5             \ to return from the subroutine with the C flag set, as
 553++F357 A6                               and     (hl)
 554++F358 FA 43 F3                         jp      m, LL109_6502           ; BMI LL109              \ the entire line is above the top of the screen
 555++F35B 3A 29 F1                         ld      a,(XX1532+1)            ; LDA XX15+3             \ If both y1_hi and y2_hi have bit 7 set, jump to LL109
 556++F35E 21 2D F1                         ld      hl,XX1576+1             ; AND XX12+1             \ to return from the subroutine with the C flag set, as
 557++F361 A6                               and     (hl)                    ; BMI LL109              \ the entire line is to the left of the screen
 558++F362 FA 43 F3                         jp      m,LL109_6502            ; .
 559++F365 3A 27 F1                         ld      a,(XX1510+1)            ; LDX XX15+1             \ Set A = X = x1_hi - 1
 560++F368 3D                               dec     a                       ; DEX
 561++F369 32 36 F1                         ld      (Xreg),a                ; TXA
 562++F36C F5                               push    af                      ; LDX XX15+5             \ Set XX12+2 = x2_hi - 1, we need to save a register first
 563++F36D 3A 2B F1                         ld      a,(XX1554+1)            ; .
 564++F370 3D                               dec     a                       ; DEX
 565++F371 32 36 F1                         ld      (Xreg),a                ; STX XX12+2
 566++F374 F1                               pop     af                      ; .                      restore a register
 567++F375 21 2D F1                         ld      hl,XX1576+1             ; ORA XX12+2             \ If neither (x1_hi - 1) or (x2_hi - 1) have bit 7 set,
 568++F378 B6                               or      (hl)                    ; .
 569++F379 F2 43 F3                         jp      p, LL109_6502           ; BPL LL109              \ jump to LL109 to return from the subroutine with the C flag set, as the line doesn't fit on-screen
 570++F37C 3A 28 F1                         ld      a,(XX1532)              ; LDA XX15+2             \ If y1_lo < y-coordinate of screen bottom, clear the C
 571++F37F FE 80                            cp      128                     ; CMP #Y*2               \ flag, otherwise set it
 572++F381 3A 29 F1                         ld      a,(XX1532+1)           ; LDA XX15+3             \ Set XX12+2 = y1_hi - (1 - C), so:
 573++F384                                  FlipCarryFlag                   ; as 6502 uses borrow in subtracts we flip for SBC
 573++F384 3F          >                        ccf
 574++F385 DE 00                            sbc     0                       ; SBC #0                 \ .
 575++F387 32 2E F1                         ld      (XX12p2),a              ; STA XX12+2             \  * Set XX12+2 = y1_hi - 1 if y1_lo is on-screen * Set XX12+2 = y1_hi  otherwise We do this subtraction because we are only interested
 576++F38A 3A 2C F1                         ld      a,(XX1576)              ; LDA XX12               \ If y2_lo < y-coordinate of screen bottom, clear the C
 577++F38D FE 80                            cp      128                     ; CMP #Y*2               \ flag, otherwise set it
 578++F38F 3A 2D F1                         ld      a,(XX1576+1)            ; LDA XX12+1             \ Set XX12+2 = y2_hi - (1 - C), so:
 579++F392                                  FlipCarryFlag
 579++F392 3F          >                        ccf
 580++F393 DE 00                            sbc     0                       ; SBC #0                   * Set XX12+1 = y2_hi - 1 if y2_lo is on-screen  * Set XX12+1 = y2_hi     otherwise
 581++F395 21 2E F1                         ld      hl,XX12p2               ; ORA XX12+2             \ If neither XX12+1 or XX12+2 have bit 7 set, jump to
 582++F398 B6                               or      (hl)                    ; .
 583++F399 F2 43 F3                         jp      p,LL109_6502            ; BPL LL109              \ LL109 to return from the subroutine with the C flag set, as the line doesn't fit on-screen
 584++F39C              ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 585++F39C              ;-- LL145 (Part 3 of 4) Summary: Clip line: Calculate the line's gradient
 586++F39C 3A 37 F1     LL115_6502:         ld      a,(Yreg)                ; TYA                    \ Store Y on the stack so we can preserve it through the call to this routine
 587++F39F F5                               push    af                      ; PHA                    \ call to this subroutine
 588++F3A0 2A 2A F1                         ld      hl,(XX1554)             ; LDA XX15+4             \ Set XX12+2 = x2_lo - x1_lo
 589++F3A3 ED 5B 26 F1                      ld      de,(XX1510)             ; LDA XX15+5             \ Set XX12+3 = x2_hi - x1_hi
 590++F3A7                                  ClearCarryFlag                  ; SBC XX15+1
 590++F3A7 B7          >                        or a
 591++F3A8 ED 52                            sbc     hl,de                   ; .
 592++F3AA 22 BF F5                         ld      (delta_x),hl            ; .
 593++F3AD 2A 2C F1                         ld      hl,(XX1576)             ; LDA XX12               \ Set XX12+4 = y2_lo - y1_lo
 594++F3B0 ED 5B 28 F1                      ld      de,(XX1532)             ;
 595++F3B4                                  ClearCarryFlag                  ; SBC XX15+2
 595++F3B4 B7          >                        or a
 596++F3B5 ED 52                            sbc     hl,de                   ; .
 597++F3B7 22 C1 F5                         ld      (delta_y),hl            ; .
 598++F3BA              ; So we now have:  delta_x in XX12(3 2)  delta_y in XX12(5 4) where the delta is (x1, y1) - (x2, y2))
 599++F3BA 3A C2 F5                         ld      a,(delta_y+1)           ; EOR XX12+3             \ Set S = the sign of delta_x * the sign of delta_y, so
 600++F3BD 21 C0 F5                         ld      hl,delta_x+1
 601++F3C0 AE                               xor     (hl)
 602++F3C1 32 35 F1                         ld      (Svar),a                ; STA S                  \ if bit 7 of S is set, the deltas have different signs (perhaps we should do bit 7 mask ?????????
 603++F3C4 2A C1 F5                         ld      hl,(delta_y)            ; LDA XX12+5             \ If delta_y_hi is positive, jump down to LL110 to skip
 604++F3C7 7C                               ld      a,h
 605++F3C8 A7                               and     a
 606++F3C9 F2 D5 F3                         jp      p, LL110_6502           ; BPL LL110              \ the following
 607++F3CC                                  NegHL                           ; LDA #0                 \ Otherwise flip the sign of delta_y to make it
 607++F3CC AF          >                    xor a
 607++F3CD 95          >                    sub l
 607++F3CE 6F          >                    ld l,a
 607++F3CF 9F          >                    sbc a,a
 607++F3D0 94          >                    sub h
 607++F3D1 67          >                    ld h,a
 608++F3D2 22 C1 F5                         ld      (delta_y),hl            ; positive, starting with the low bytes
 609++F3D5 2A BF F5     LL110_6502:         ld      hl,(delta_x)            ; LDA XX12+3             \ If delta_x_hi is positive, jump down to LL111 to skip
 610++F3D8 7C                               ld      a,h                     ; BPL LL111              \ the following
 611++F3D9 A7                               and     a                       ; .
 612++F3DA F2 E6 F3                         jp      p,LL111_6502            ; .
 613++F3DD                                  NegHL                           ; SEC                    \ Otherwise flip the sign of delta_x to make it
 613++F3DD AF          >                    xor a
 613++F3DE 95          >                    sub l
 613++F3DF 6F          >                    ld l,a
 613++F3E0 9F          >                    sbc a,a
 613++F3E1 94          >                    sub h
 613++F3E2 67          >                    ld h,a
 614++F3E3 22 BF F5                         ld      (delta_x),hl            ; LDA #0                 \ positive, starting with the low bytes
 615++F3E6              ;--  We now keep halving |delta_x| and |delta_y| until both of them have zero in their high bytes
 616++F3E6 2A BF F5     LL111_6502:         ld      hl,(delta_x)
 617++F3E9 ED 5B C1 F5                      ld      de,(delta_y)
 618++F3ED 7C                               ld      a,h                     ; TAX                    \ If |delta_x_hi| is non-zero, skip the following
 619++F3EE B2                               or      d                       ; BNE LL112
 620++F3EF CA FD F3                         jp      z,LL113_6502           ; LDX XX12+5             \ If |delta_y_hi| = 0, jump down to LL113 (as both |delta_x_hi| and |delta_y_hi| are 0)
 621++F3F2              LL112_6502:         ShiftHLRight1                   ; LSR A                  \ Halve the value of delta_x in (A XX12+2)
 621++F3F2 CB 3C       >			   srl h
 621++F3F4 CB 1D       >			   rr  l
 622++F3F6                                  ShiftDERight1                   ; LSR XX12+5             \ Halve the value of delta_y XX12(5 4)
 622++F3F6 CB 3A       >			   srl d
 622++F3F8 CB 1B       >			   rr  e
 623++F3FA C3 E6 F3                         jp  LL111_6502                  ; JMP LL111              \ Loop back to LL111
 624++F3FD              ;-- By now, the high bytes of both |delta_x| and |delta_y| are zero
 625++F3FD              LL113_6502:         ZeroA                           ; STX T                  \ We know that X = 0 as that's what we tested with a BEQ  above, so this sets T = 0
 625++F3FD AF          >                        xor a
 626++F3FE 32 32 F1                         ld  (Tvar),a
 627++F401 3A BF F5                         ld      a,(delta_x)             ; LDA XX12+2             \ If delta_x_lo < delta_y_lo, so our line is more
 628++F404 21 C1 F5                         ld      hl,delta_y              ; CMP XX12+4             \ vertical than horizontal, jump to LL114
 629++F407 BE                               cp      (hl)
 630++F408 DA 1A F4                         jp      c, LL114_6502           ; BCC LL114              ; of delta y as > delta x then its a steep slope
 631++F40B              ;-- If we get here then our line is more horizontal than vertical, so it is a shallow slope
 632++F40B 3A BF F5                         ld      a,(delta_x)             ; STA Q                  \ Set Q = delta_x_lo
 633++F40E 32 33 F1                         ld      (Qvar),a                ; .
 634++F411 3A C1 F5                         ld      a,(delta_y)             ; LDA XX12+4             \ Set A = delta_y_lo
 635++F414 CD 38 F1                         call    LL28_6502               ; JSR LL28               \ Call LL28 to calculate: R = 256 * A / Q = 256 * delta_y_lo / delta_x_lo
 636++F417 C3 2B F4                         jp      LL116_6502              ; JMP LL116              \ Jump to LL116, as we now have the line's gradient in R
 637++F41A              ;-- If we get here then our line is more vertical than horizontal, so it is a steep slope
 638++F41A 3A C1 F5     LL114_6502:         ld      a,(delta_y)             ; LDA XX12+4             \ Set Q = delta_y_lo
 639++F41D 32 33 F1                         ld      (Qvar),a                ; STA Q
 640++F420 3A BF F5                         ld      a,(delta_x)             ; LDA XX12+2             \ Set A = delta_x_lo
 641++F423 CD 38 F1                         call    LL28_6502               ; JSR LL28               \ Call LL28 to calculate: R = 256 * A / Q = 256 * delta_x_lo / delta_y_lo
 642++F426 3E FF                            ld      a,$FF                   ; DEC T                  \ T was set to 0 above, so this sets T = &FF when our
 643++F428 32 32 F1                         ld      (Tvar),a                ;                        \ line is steep
 644++F42B              ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 645++F42B              ;--- LL116 This part sets things up to call the routine in LL188, which does the actual clipping.
 646++F42B              ;--  If we get here, then R has been set to the gradient of the line (x1, y1) to(x2, y2), with T indicating the gradient of slope: * 0   = shallow slope (more horizontal than vertical)
 647++F42B              ;--                                                                                                                                * &FF = steep slope (more vertical than horizontal)
 648++F42B              ;-- XX13 has been set as follows: * 0   = (x1, y1) off-screen, (x2, y2) on-screen * 95(64)  = (x1, y1) on-screen,  (x2, y2) off-screen * 191(128) = (x1, y1) off-screen, (x2, y2) off-screen
 649++F42B 3A 34 F1     LL116_6502:         ld      a,(Rvar)                ; LDA R                  \ Store the gradient in XX12+2
 650++F42E 32 2E F1                         ld      (XX12p2),a              ; STA XX12+2
 651++F431 3A 35 F1                         ld      a,(Svar)                ; LDA S                  \ Store the type of slope in XX12+3, bit 7 clear means
 652++F434 32 2F F1                         ld      (XX12p3),a              ; STA XX12+3             \ top left to bottom right, bit 7 set means top right to bottom left
 653++F437 3A 70 7E                         ld      a,(XX13)                ; LDA XX13               \ If XX13 = 0, skip the following instruction
 654++F43A FE 00                            cp      0                       ; BEQ LL138
 655++F43C CA 42 F4                         jp      z,LL138_6502            ; .
 656++F43F F2 5E F4                         jp      p, LLX117_6502          ; If XX13 is positive, it must be 95 (64) as 128 would be negative). This means (x1, y1) is on-screen but (x2, y2) isn't, so we jump
 657++F442              ;-- If we get here, XX13 = 0 or 191, so (x1, y1) is off-screen and needs clipping
 658++F442 CD 80 F2     LL138_6502:         call    LL118_6502              ; JSR LL118              \ Call LL118 to move (x1, y1) along the line onto the screen, i.e. clip the line at the (x1, y1) end
 659++F445 3A 70 7E                         ld      a,(XX13)                ; LDA XX13               \ If XX13 = 0, i.e. (x2, y2) is on-screen, jump down to
 660++F448 A7                               and     a
 661++F449 F2 81 F4                         jp      p,LL124_6502            ; BPL LL124              \ LL124 to return with a successfully clipped line
 662++F44C              ;-- If we get here, XX13 = 191 (128) (both coordinates areoff-screen)
 663++F44C 3A 27 F1     LL117_6502:         ld      a,(XX1510+1)            ; LDA XX15+1             \ If either of x1_hi or y1_hi are non-zero, jump to
 664++F44F 21 29 F1                         ld      hl,XX1532+1             ; ORA XX15+3             \ LL137 to return from the subroutine with the C flag
 665++F452 B6                               or      (hl)
 666++F453 C2 88 F4                         jp      nz, LL137_6502          ; BNE LL137              \ set, as the line doesn't fit on-screen
 667++F456 3A 28 F1                         ld      a,(XX1532)              ; LDA XX15+2             \ If y1_lo > y-coordinate of the bottom of the screen
 668++F459 FE 80                            cp      128                     ; CMP #Y*2               \ jump to LL137 to return from the subroutine with the
 669++F45B D2 88 F4                         jp      nc, LL137_6502          ; BCS LL137              \ C flag set, as the line doesn't fit on-screen
 670++F45E              ;-- If we get here, XX13 = 95 or 191, and in both cases (x2, y2) is off-screen, so we now need to swap the (x1, y1) and (x2, y2) coordinates around before doing the actual clipping, because we need to clip (x2, y2) but the clipping routine at LL118 only clips (x1, y1)
 671++F45E 2A 26 F1     LLX117_6502:        ld      hl,(XX1510)             ; LDX XX15               \ Swap x1_lo = x2_lo
 672++F461 ED 5B 28 F1                      ld      de,(XX1532)
 673++F465 ED 53 26 F1                      ld      (XX1510),de
 674++F469 22 28 F1                         ld      (XX1532),hl
 675++F46C 2A 2A F1                         ld      hl,(XX1554)             ;  LDX XX15+2             \ Swap y1_lo = y2_lo
 676++F46F ED 5B 2C F1                      ld      de,(XX1576)
 677++F473 ED 53 2A F1                      ld      (XX1554),de
 678++F477 22 2C F1                         ld      (XX1576),hl
 679++F47A CD 80 F2                         call    LL118_6502              ; JSR LL118              \ Call LL118 to move (x1, y1) along the line onto the screen, i.e. clip the line at the (x1, y1) end
 680++F47D 21 18 C9                         ld      hl,SWAP
 681++F480 35                               dec     (hl)                    ; DEC SWAP               \ Set SWAP = &FF to indicate that we just clipped the line at the (x2, y2) end by swapping the coordinates (the DEC does this as we set SWAP to 0 at the start of this subroutine)
 682++F481 F1           LL124_6502:         pop     af                      ; PLA                    \ Restore Y from the stack so it gets preserved through
 683++F482 32 37 F1                         ld      (Yreg),a                ; TAY                    \ the call to this subroutine
 684++F485 CD 2A F3                         call    LL146_6502              ; JMP LL146              \ Jump up to LL146 to move the low bytes of (x1, y1) and (x2, y2) into (X1, Y1) and (X2, Y2), and return from the subroutine with a successfully clipped line
 685++F488 F1           LL137_6502:         pop     af                      ; PLA                    \ Restore Y from the stack so it gets preserved through
 686++F489 32 37 F1                         ld      (Yreg),a                ; TAY                    \ the call to this subroutine
 687++F48C                                  SetCarryFlag                    ; SEC                    \ Set the C flag to indicate the clipped line does not fit on-screen
 687++F48C 37          >                        scf
 688++F48D C9                               ret                             ; RTS                    \ Return from the subroutine
 689++F48E                      ENDIF
# file closed: ././Layer2Graphics/BBCEliteDirectMappingLL118.asm
   9+ F48E
  10+ F48E              l2_drawHorzClipY:
  11+ F48E EB           .ClipY:                 ex      de,hl                       ; get X1 into de
  12+ F48F CB 7A        .ClipDE:                bit     7,d
  13+ F491 28 06                                jr      z,.DEPositive
  14+ F493 11 00 00     .DENegative:            ld      de,0
  15+ F496 C3 AC F4                             jp      .ClipDEDone
  16+ F499 7A           .DEPositive:            ld      a,d
  17+ F49A A7                                   and     a
  18+ F49B CA A4 F4                             jp      z,.ClipDE127
  19+ F49E 11 7F 00     .ClipDE256:             ld      de,127
  20+ F4A1 C3 AC F4                             jp      .ClipDEDone
  21+ F4A4 CB 7B        .ClipDE127:             bit     7,e
  22+ F4A6 CA AC F4                             jp      z,.ClipDEDone
  23+ F4A9 11 7F 00                             ld      de,127
  24+ F4AC              .ClipDEDone:
  25+ F4AC 2A DF EE     .AdjustStartY:          ld      hl,(starty)
  26+ F4AF CD 22 98                             call    CompareHLDESgn           ; if de < HL
  27+ F4B2 28 06                                jr      z,.AdjustEndY               ;
  28+ F4B4 38 04                                jr      c,.AdjustEndY               ;
  29+ F4B6 ED 53 DF EE  .ClipStartY:            ld      (starty),de                 ; .
  30+ F4BA 2A E1 EE     .AdjustEndY:            ld      hl,(endy)                   ; is endy still uninitialised
  31+ F4BD 7C           .InitEndY:              ld      a,h                         ;
  32+ F4BE A5                                   and     l                           ;
  33+ F4BF FE FF                                cp      $FF                         ;
  34+ F4C1 28 05                                jr      z,.ForceEndYSet
  35+ F4C3 CD 22 98     .CheckEndY:             call    CompareHLDESgn           ; if de < HL
  36+ F4C6 C8                                   ret     z
  37+ F4C7 D0                                   ret     nc
  38+ F4C8 ED 53 E1 EE  .ForceEndYSet:          ld      (endy),de
  39+ F4CC C9                                   ret

  41+ F4CD
  42+ F4CD 2A 97 F5     l2_drawVertClip:        ld      hl,(y1)
  43+ F4D0 ED 5B 9B F5                          ld      de,(y2)
  44+ F4D4 CD 22 98                             call    CompareHLDESgn
  45+ F4D7 30 01                                jr      nc,.y1ltey2
  46+ F4D9 EB                                   ex      de,hl
  47+ F4DA CB 7C        .y1ltey2:               bit     7,h
  48+ F4DC CA E2 F4                             jp      z,.y1Positive
  49+ F4DF 21 00 00                             ld      hl,0
  50+ F4E2 7A           .y1Positive             ld      a,d
  51+ F4E3 A7                                   and     a
  52+ F4E4 CA EC F4                             jp      z,.y2lt255
  53+ F4E7 1E 7F                                ld      e,127
  54+ F4E9 C3 F3 F4                             jp      .y2Clipped
  55+ F4EC CB 7B        .y2lt255:               bit     7,e
  56+ F4EE CA F3 F4                             jp      z,.y2Clipped
  57+ F4F1 1E 7F                                ld      e,127
  58+ F4F3 ED 4B 95 F5  .y2Clipped:             ld      bc,(x1)
  59+ F4F7 45                                   ld      b,l
  60+ F4F8 53                                   ld      d,e
  61+ F4F9 1E BF                                ld      e,$BF
  62+ F4FB C3 55 E5                             jp      l2_draw_vert_line_to                ; ">bc = row col d = to position, e = color"
  63+ F4FE
  64+ F4FE 2A 95 F5     l2_drawHorzClip:        ld      hl,(x1)
  65+ F501 ED 5B 99 F5                          ld      de,(x2)
  66+ F505 CD 22 98                             call    CompareHLDESgn
  67+ F508 30 01                                jr      nc,.x1ltex2
  68+ F50A EB                                   ex      de,hl
  69+ F50B CB 7C        .x1ltex2:               bit     7,h
  70+ F50D CA 13 F5                             jp      z,.x1Positive
  71+ F510 21 00 00                             ld      hl,0
  72+ F513 7A           .x1Positive             ld      a,d
  73+ F514 A7                                   and     a
  74+ F515 CA 1A F5                             jp      z,.x2Clipped
  75+ F518 1E FF                                ld      e,255
  76+ F51A ED 4B 97 F5  .x2Clipped:             ld      bc,(y1)
  77+ F51E 41                                   ld      b,c
  78+ F51F 4D                                   ld      c,l
  79+ F520 53                                   ld      d,e
  80+ F521 1E BF                                ld      e,$BF
  81+ F523 C3 BD E4                             jp      l2_draw_horz_line_to                ; "bc = left side row,col, d right pixel, e = color"
  82+ F526
  83+ F526 CB 7A        l2_drawVertClipY:       bit     7,d                     ; i = (py1<0?0:py1);
  84+ F528 28 03                                jr      z,.PYIsOK
  85+ F52A 11 00 00     .SetPYTo0:              ld      de,0
  86+ F52D 2A DF EE     .PYIsOK:                ld      hl,(starty)
  87+ F530                                      IsHLEqu255
  87+ F530 7C          >                        ld      a,h
  87+ F531 A7          >                        and     a               ; if its non zero then it can't be 255
  87+ F532 C0          >                        ret     nz
  87+ F533 7D          >                        ld      a,l
  87+ F534 3C          >                        inc     a               ; if it was 255 the inc will set it to zero
  88+ F535 CA 40 F5                             jp      z,.UpdateStartY
  89+ F538 CD 22 98                             call    CompareHLDESgn       ; or starty > py
  90+ F53B 30 03                                jr      nc,.UpdateStartY        ;
  91+ F53D C3 44 F5                             jp      .PrepareUpdateArray
  92+ F540 ED 53 DF EE  .UpdateStartY:          ld      (starty),de
  93+ F544              .PrepareUpdateArray:    JumpIfRegLTE c, 127, .UpdateCounters ; we loop from
  93+ F544 79          >                        ld      a,c
  93+ F545 FE 7F       >                        cp      127
